infobox.name: Tempest
infobox.weaponquote: Fully automatic assault rifle with moderate fire rate and accuracy.

infobox.name: Rattler
infobox.weaponquote: Fully automatic assault rifle. A cheap offensive option, but has to be reloaded 2 bullets at a time.

infobox.name: Kettle
infobox.weaponquote: Semi-automatic assault rifle. Quick and accurate, but has low bullet velocity and takes a long time reload.

infobox.name: Bettina
infobox.weaponquote: Has slow fire rate and high damage output.

infobox.name: Arpeggio
infobox.weaponquote: A 3-round burst assault rifle with decent damage output and accuracy.

infobox.name: Ferro
infobox.weaponquote: Heavy break-action rifle. Packs a punch, but must be reloaded between every shot.

infobox.name: Renegade
infobox.weaponquote: Lever-action battle rifle with high damage output, accuracy, and headshot damage.

infobox.name: Aphelion
infobox.weaponquote: Fires high velocity energy rounds.

infobox.name: Stitcher
infobox.weaponquote: Full automatic SMG. Deals good damage, but has quite a low fire-rate and can be hard to control.

infobox.name: Bobcat
infobox.weaponquote: Fully automatic SMG with high fire rate but low accuracy.

infobox.name: Il Toro
infobox.weaponquote: Pump-action shotgun with large bullet spread, sharp falloff, and high damage output.

infobox.name: Vulcano
infobox.weaponquote: Semi-automatic shotgun with good bullet spread but sharp falloff

infobox.name: Hairpin
infobox.weaponquote: Single-action pistol with a built-in silencer. Great for stealth, but tricky in combat.

infobox.name: Burletta
infobox.weaponquote: Semi-automatic pistol with decent damage output and accuracy. Can be fired as fast as you can pull the trigger.

infobox.name: Anvil
infobox.weaponquote: Single-action hand cannon with high damage output and headshot damage, but slow handling.

infobox.name: Venator
infobox.weaponquote: Semi-automatic pistol. Fires two shots at a time.

infobox.name: Torrente
infobox.weaponquote: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched.

infobox.name: Osprey
infobox.weaponquote: A scoped bolt-action sniper rifle with reliable damage output and accuracy.

infobox.name: Jupiter
infobox.weaponquote: A bolt-action sniper rifle with exceptional damage output and accuracy, but slow handling.

name: Hullcracker

infobox.name: Hullcracker
infobox.weaponquote: Fires explosive projectiles that only detonate when hitting ARC.

sources: * Blueprint obtained from The Major's Footlocker

infobox.name: Equalizer
infobox.weaponquote: A high capacity experimental beam rifle.

infobox.name: Free Loadout Augment
infobox.quote: Basic augment for rookie Raiders, offering slightly more backpack space and carry capacity.

infobox.name: Looting Mk. 1
infobox.quote: Basic looting augment. More backpack slots and weight capacity, but low defensive and tactical capability.

infobox.name: Combat Mk. 1
infobox.quote: Basic combat augment. Supports stronger shields, but with limited backpack capacity and Quick Use slots.

infobox.name: Tactical Mk. 1
infobox.quote: Basic tactical augment. More Quick Use slots for more tactical choice, but limited survivability and slightly lower looting potential.

infobox.name: Looting Mk. 2
infobox.warning: Automatically throws off attached Ticks after 1s.
infobox.quote: Significantly increases looting potential; adds slots for trinkets.

infobox.name: Combat Mk. 2
infobox.warning: Restores 1 health every 5 seconds. When damage is taken, the effect is paused for 30 seconds.
infobox.quote: A combat augment more focused on maneuverability than absorbing damage.

infobox.name: Tactical Mk. 2
infobox.warning: Upon Shield break, deploys a small smoke grenade. Has a fixed cooldown.
infobox.quote: Adds more backpack space and an extra utility item slot.

infobox.name: Looting Mk. 3 (Cautious)
infobox.warning: Upon Shield break, automatically administers a weak Adrenaline Shot. Has a fixed cooldown.
infobox.quote: A looting augment that swaps some carry capacity to increase survivability.

infobox.name: Looting Mk. 3 (Survivor)
infobox.warning: While downed and stationary, health regenerates up to 75% of max downed health.
infobox.quote: A heavy-duty pack mule augment. Large weight capacity and large backpack space.

infobox.name: Combat Mk. 3 (Aggressive)
infobox.warning: Restores 2 health every 5 seconds. When damage is taken the effect is paused for 30 seconds.
infobox.quote: An improved version of the Combat II augment. Supports more shield types, and comes with extra space for grenades.

infobox.name: Combat Mk. 3 (Flanking)
infobox.warning: Stowed or unequipped Pistols and Hand Cannons are 33% faster to equip.
infobox.quote: A combat augment more focused on manueverability than absorbing damage.

infobox.name: Tactical Mk. 3 (Defensive)
infobox.warning: Allows Shield Rechargers to be used while running.
infobox.quote: A defensive-focused augment for keeping Shields topped up.

infobox.name: Tactical Mk. 3 (Healing)
infobox.warning: When revived from being downed, releases a healing cloud that restores 20 health over 10 seconds. Has a 30-second cooldown.
infobox.quote: A healing-focused augment which adds extra slots for healing items.

infobox.name: Light Shield
infobox.quote: A lightweight shield that offers limited protection without severely impacting mobility.

infobox.name: Medium Shield
infobox.quote: A standard shield that offers fair protection at a moderate cost to mobility.

infobox.name: Heavy Shield
infobox.quote: A heavy shield that blocks a large portion of incoming damage, but carries a significant cost to mobility.

infobox.name: Bandage
infobox.quote: A medical item that gradually restores health over time.

infobox.name: Defibrillator
infobox.quote: An injection that quickly revived downed raiders and restores some health.

infobox.name: Fruit Mix
infobox.quote: A food item that moderately increases both health and stamina.

infobox.name: Herbal Bandage
infobox.quote: An improvised medical item that gradually restores health over time.

infobox.name: Sterilized Bandage
infobox.quote: A medical item that gradually restores a large amount of health over time.

infobox.name: Vita Shot
infobox.quote: A medical item that restores a large amount of health.

infobox.name: Vita Spray
infobox.quote: A medical item that continuously restores health during use. Can be used on yourself or your allies.

infobox.name: Integrated Shield Recharger
infobox.quote: Reusable Shield Recharger on a fixed cooldown. Can be used like a normal Shield Charger, but cannot be dropped or removed from its slot.

infobox.name: Shield Recharger
infobox.quote: A handheld repair kit that recharges a shield over time.

infobox.name: Surge Shield Recharger
infobox.quote: A handheld kit that recharges a shield on use.

infobox.name: Adrenaline Shot
infobox.quote: A serum that fully restores stamina and temporarily increases stamina regeneration.

infobox.name: Agave Juice
infobox.quote: A concoction that temporarily increases stamina regeneration, at a small initial cost to health.

infobox.name: Barricade Kit
infobox.quote: A deployable cover that can block incoming damage until it breaks.

infobox.name: Door Blocker
infobox.quote: A locking mechanism that can be placed on large metal doors to limit access.

infobox.name: Remote Raider Flare
infobox.quote: A deployable device that, when manually triggered, launches a Raider Distress Flare.

infobox.name: Zipline
infobox.quote: A deployable zipline that allows you to quickly move between two locations.

infobox.name: Binoculars
infobox.quote: A basic pair of binoculars with two levels of magnification.

infobox.name: Flame Spray
infobox.quote: A classic makeshift weapon, sure to leave scorch marks.

infobox.name: Integrated Binoculars
infobox.quote: Can be equipped and used like regular binoculars, but cannot be dropped or removed from their slot.

infobox.name: Noisemaker
infobox.quote: A deployable proximity sensor that sounds an alarm when enemy raiders are detected.

infobox.name: Photoelectric Cloak
infobox.quote: A gadget that allows the user to conceal themselves from ARC.

infobox.name: Recorder
infobox.quote: A playable recorder used to attract ARC's attention, and impress other Raiders.

name: Snap Hook

infobox.name: Snap Hook
infobox.quote: A gadget that allows the user to scale structures and cover large distances.

sources: Reward for the quest Lost In Transmission

infobox.name: Light Impact Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that detonates on impact, dealing explosive damage in a small radius.

infobox.name: Heavy Fuze Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that detonates after a delay, dealing explosive damage in its radius.

infobox.name: Blaze Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that detonates on impact, covering an area in fire that deals damage over time.

infobox.name: Gas Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that creates a lingering toxic cloud on impact, draining the stamina of any Raiders within its area of effect.

infobox.name: Showstopper
infobox.quote: A grenade that detonates after a delay, stunning enemies within its radius.

infobox.name: Snap Blast Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that sticks to surfaces, dealing explosive damage after a short delay.

infobox.name: Seeker Grenade
infobox.quote: A homing grenade that targets a single nearby ARC dealing explosive damage on impact.

infobox.name: Shrapnel Grenade
infobox.quote: A makeshift fuze grenade that bursts into razor-sharp fragments upon detonation.

infobox.name: Trigger 'Nade
infobox.quote: A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered.

name: Trailblazer

infobox.name: Trailblazer
infobox.quote: A grenade that emits a trail of flammable gas along its path, causing an explosive chain reaction when it ignites.

sources: Live Event: Staking Our Claim - 1350 Merits.

infobox.name: Wolfpack
infobox.quote: A grenade that scatters into multiple homing missiles, each one targeting ARC and dealing explosive damage on impact.

infobox.name: Lure Grenade
infobox.quote: A noise device that sticks to surfaces, distracting nearby ARC machines and drawing their fire.

infobox.name: Li'l Smoke Grenade
infobox.quote: A Grenade that pops into a thick but small smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from ARC and other Raiders.

infobox.name: Smoke Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that creates a lingering smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from other Raiders.

infobox.name: Tagging Grenade
infobox.quote: A grenade that detonates after a delay, tagging Raiders and ARC enemies in an area, allowing you to briefly track their location.

infobox.name: Light Stick
infobox.quote: A throwable chemical light that illuminates the area around it.

infobox.name: Blaze Grenade Trap
infobox.quote: laser trip wire that detonates a Blaze Grenade.

infobox.name: Gas Grenade Trap
infobox.quote: A laser trip write that detonates a Gas Grenade.

infobox.name: Lure Grenade Trap
infobox.quote: A laser trip wire that detonates a Lure Grenade

infobox.name: Smoke Grenade Trap
infobox.quote: A laser trip write that detonates a Smoke Grenade.

infobox.name: Explosive Mine
infobox.quote: A proximity triggered mine that pops up and explodes, dealing damage to anything within its radius.

infobox.name: Gas Mine
infobox.quote: A proximity-triggered mine that pops up and deploys a gas cloud that rapidly drains stamina.

infobox.name: Jolt Mine
infobox.quote: A proximity trigger mine that pops up and stuns anything within its radius.

infobox.name: Pulse Mine
infobox.quote: A proximity-triggered mine that pops up and knocks back anything within its radius.

infobox.name: Deadline
infobox.quote: A mine that deals damage to anything within its radius once the timer runs out.

infobox.attachquote: Slightly reduces per-shot dispersion.
Slightly reduces both vertical recoil & horizontal recoil.
Slightly reduces base dispersion.
Slightly reduces horizontal recoil.
Slightly reduces vertical recoil.
Slightly extends the ammo capacity of compatible weapons that use light ammo.
Slightly extends the ammo capacity of compatible weapons that use medium ammo.
Slightly extends the ammo capacity of shotguns
Slightly improves dispersion & recoil recovery time.

infobox.name: Compensator II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately reduces per-shot dispersion.
Moderately reduces both vertical recoil & horizontal recoil.
Moderately reduces base dispersion.
Slightly reduces the amount of noise produced when firing.

infobox.name: Angled Grip II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately reduces horizontal recoil.

infobox.name: Vertical Grip II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately reduces vertical recoil.

infobox.name: Extended Light Mag II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately extends the ammo capacity of the compatible weapons that use light ammo.

infobox.name: Extended Medium Mag II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately extends the ammo capacity of compatible weapons that use medium ammo.
Moderately extends the ammo capacity of compatible weapons that use shotgun ammo.

infobox.name: Stack Stock II
infobox.attachquote: Slightly improves dispersion & recoil recovery time.
Significantly reduces per-shot dispersion.
Signifcantly reduces both vertical recoil & horizontal recoil.
Significantly reduces base dispersion.

infobox.name: Silencer II
infobox.attachquote: Moderately reduces the amount of noise produced when firing.
Moderately reduces the amount of noise produced when firing.

infobox.name: Extended Barrel
infobox.attachquote: Moderately increases bullet velocity.
Significantly reduces horizontal recoil
Significantly reduces vertical recoil.

infobox.name: Horizontal Grip
infobox.attachquote: Moderately reduces both vertical and horizontal recoil.
Significantly extends the ammo capacity of the compatible weapons that use light ammo.
Significantly extends the ammo capacity of compatible weapons that use medium ammo.

infobox.name: Extended Shotgun Mag III
infobox.attachquote: Significantly extends the ammo capacity of the compatible weapons that use shotgun ammo.
Significantly improves dispersion & recoil recovery over time.
Moderately improves ADS & draw speed.

infobox.name: Padded Stock
infobox.attachquote: Significantly improves stability.
Moderately increases fire rate.
Tech mod for the Anvil that replaces its bullets with ones that split into 4 weaker projectiles.
